meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to lose their sense of direction.
meanings.sent1: The maze in the park can be disorientating for first-time visitors.
meanings.sent2: The sudden change in the room layout disorientated the guests.
meanings.sent3: Trying to walk with your eyes closed can be quite disorientating!
meanings.sent4: The complex road signs can be disorientating for drivers unfamiliar with the area.
meanings.sent5: The spinning amusement park ride was incredibly disorientating.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel confused or disoriented.
meanings.sent1: The conflicting instructions were disorientating for the new employees.
meanings.sent2: The loud noises disorientated the small child in the crowded mall.
meanings.sent3: Mixing up the identical twins can be disorientating for their friends!
meanings.sent4: The constantly changing weather can be disorientating for those with seasonal allergies.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was truly disorientating.
